It's like the starting point; if you don't reach it, you can't fire. - **Hyperpolarization**: This is when the membrane potential becomes more negative than rest. So, going from +10mV to -40mV would be hyperpolarization. - **Action potential**: This is the electrical signal that travels along a neuron's axon. It's generated when the membrane potential goes from depolarized (positive) to hyperpolarized (negative). - **Equilibrium potential**: This refers to the resting potential of a neuron, which is usually around -60mV.
